I've been through something similar. Take a deep breath; you wll be okay. Start saving some emergency cash and have a frank conversation with your SO. Your relationship is strong enough to talk. Reduce any expenses you can. Start browsing alternative housing in your affordability bracket. Take 1 day at a time. Hopefully you have a vehicle. As long as you can afford a roof and food, you will be fine.

There is, in fact, a list of about 10 food items that can basically help you live to 100 years old if you follow a moderately strict diet.
Kale, Broccoli. Garlic/Onion (Allium vegetables), Salmon, Oats, Pomegranate, Turmeric, Mushrooms, Hemp oil

Do your best to get a job and simplify your outgoing costs as much as you can. At your age, you need a cheap car and a good phone plan.
Pick between 4 and 10 local jobs to go for a week. Explain your situation to an employer and tell them you will work hard. Employers are people, and they hire people, not robots - so I'm sure an employer will give you a chance.
Believe in yourself. Value each dollar in your wallet.

Is soup fair exchange for an Armani suit?

A friend and I were stranded in the South Australian country; having to walk 10 miles between a town of 1500 people to a town of less than 100 people.
4am and we are half way through our journey when a man in a milk van drives up to us. We never heard him coming.
"I'll give you a ride" he says, in a high pitched elongated yawn.
"Na, it's cool man, we're okay walking", we said.
"There was no way we were going with him", my friend exclaimed as he drove off.
2 weeks later, we are in the town bakery. As we shopped we discussed the 'weird milkman' incident.
Desperately, the woman working behind the counter asks: "when did this happen"?!
"2 weeks ago on Saturday", I replied.
She began crying and a lady doing some shopping told us not to be so insensitive.
"What do you mean"? we asked.
"Her husband, the milkman', died 4 weeks ago.
He was described exactly as we remember him. Apart from one thing...
"A high pitched voice" I asked?
"No". She replied.
"A very deep voice".
"But he did hang himself"
....."I'll give you a ride"....
